### Ingest and wrangle data


```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

src <- read.csv('archetypes/oecd-better-life-index.csv', encoding = "UTF-8")

# Apply filter (or not)
src <- filter(src, Indicator %in% c("Educational attainment", "Student skills", "Years in education"))

# Create a unique indicator name
src <- src %>% mutate(
  Indicator_Long = paste0(Indicator, "-", Inequality, "-", Unit)
)

# Select relevant fields
src_select <- src %>% select(Country, Indicator_Long, Value )
#src_select

# Convert from long to wide
data_wide <- spread(src_select, Indicator_Long, Value)
#data_wide

# The pca function can only take numeric values,
# so we convert Country column to be rownames
df <- column_to_rownames(data_wide, var = "Country")

# Use only complete cases
df <- df[complete.cases(df), ]
df


```

# Fit a principal components model

```{r,  message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# fit a principal components model
df_pca <- prcomp(x = df, 
              center = TRUE, 
              scale = TRUE)
df_pca

```

# Plot

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source='fold-hide', fig.width=1920/72, fig.height=1080/72, out.width="100%"}

# fviz_pca function produces a ggplot2 graph.
v1 <- fviz_pca(df_pca,  repel = TRUE,  labelsize = 3) + 
  theme_bw() +
  labs(title = "HDI Biplot")

# Draw plot
girafe(ggobj = v1, width_svg = 1280/72, height_svg = 720/72,
       options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0)))

```
 
 
```{r, echo=FALSE, eval=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, class.source='fold-show'}

# eval = FALSE as default; run manually as chunk

# full version
ggsave(filename = "assets/better-life-index.svg", plot = v1, width=1280/72, height=720/72)



```
